Package moulton.scalable.draggables

Class ScrollBar

  • java.lang.Object
    • moulton.scalable.utils.MenuComponent
      • moulton.scalable.clickables.Clickable
        • moulton.scalable.draggables.ScrollBar
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TouchResponsiveComponent, DraggableComponent
    public class ScrollBar
extends Clickable
implements DraggableComponent
    The scroll bar class is a Draggable component that handles mouse draggging and notifies a component to be scrolled. That component should implement ScrollableComponent.
    Author:
    Matthew Moulton

    • Field Detail

      • width

        protected java.lang.String width
        The string expressions to define the dimensions of the scroll bar on the parent panel.

      • height

        protected java.lang.String height
        The string expressions to define the dimensions of the scroll bar on the parent panel.

      • vertical

        protected boolean vertical
        Whether the scroll bar should render as a vertical:true or a horizontal:false.

      • inverseRender

        protected boolean inverseRender
        Determines the direction of +/- offset for the scroll bar. In a vertical plane, increasing offset will be moving the bar down. In a horizontal plane, increasing offset will be moving the bar right. If inverseRender is set to true, increasing offset vertically will be up and increasing offset horizonatally will be left.
        See Also:
        renderInverse(boolean)

      • scrollNeg

        protected RadioButton scrollNeg
        The buttons to click as opposed to dragging the scroll bar. This class does not handle them! It only changes them to editable/uneditable when necessary.

      • scrollPos

        protected RadioButton scrollPos
        The buttons to click as opposed to dragging the scroll bar. This class does not handle them! It only changes them to editable/uneditable when necessary.

      • scrollRate

        protected int scrollRate
        Defines the number of offsets the bar will shift for each mouse scroll that occurs. Defaults to 1.
        See Also:
        getScrollRate(), setScrollRate(int)

      • offset

        protected int offset
        The offset of the clickable portion of the bar. Possible values range from 0 to totalOffs-barOffs.
        See Also:
        getOffset(), setOffset(int)

      • totalOffs

        protected int totalOffs
        The total number of offsets in the bar. Minimum is 1.
        See Also:
        getTotalOffs(), setTotalOffs(int), setTotalOffs(int, boolean)

      • barOffs

        protected int barOffs
        The height/width of the scroll button on the bar measured in offset distances.
        See Also:
        getBarOffs(), setBarOffs(int)

      • color

        protected java.awt.Color color
        The color of the background.

      • colorButton

        protected java.awt.Color colorButton
        The color of the button

      • colorDark

        protected java.awt.Color colorDark
        The color of the button when clicked

      • colorTouched

        protected java.awt.Color colorTouched
        The color of the button when touched.
        See Also:
        setTouchedColor(Color)

    • Constructor Detail

      • ScrollBar

        public ScrollBar​(boolean vertical,
                 Panel parent,
                 int x,
                 int y,
                 java.awt.Color colorButton)
        Creates a scroll bar that will reside on the grid in the parent panel.
        Parameters:
        vertical - The orientation for this scroll bar. True is vertical and false is horizontal
        parent - the parent panel for this component.
        x - the x coordinate of this clickable in its parent's grid
        y - the y coordinate of this clickable in its parent's grid
        colorButton - the color of the button this bar will have. By default, the background is one shade lighter, and the button turns one shade darker when pressed.

      • ScrollBar

        public ScrollBar​(boolean vertical,
                 Panel parent,
                 java.lang.String x,
                 java.lang.String y,
                 java.lang.String w,
                 java.lang.String h,
                 java.awt.Color colorButton)
        Creates a scroll bar that will reside on the panel in a free-floating manner.
        Parameters:
        vertical - The orientation for this scroll bar. True is vertical and false is horizontal
        parent - the parent panel for this component.
        x - the string equation dictating where on the parent panel this component should be rendered.
        y - the string equation dictating where on the parent panel this component should be rendered.
        w - the string equation for the width of the bar on the parent panel.
        h - the string equation for the height of the bar on the parent panel.
        colorButton - the color of the button this bar will have. By default, the background is one shade lighter, and the button turns one shade darker when pressed.

        public void render​(java.awt.Graphics g,
                   int xx,
                   int yy,
                   int ww,
                   int hh)
        Description copied from class: MenuComponent
        Draws on the graphics object to represent this component visually. When this method is called, the type of panel storing (grid or free) has been taken into account and the dimensions of the space given to this component have been calculated using MenuComponent.solveString(String, int, int).
        Specified by:
        render in class MenuComponent
        Parameters:
        g - the graphics object to draw on
        xx - the x-position on the graphics image that this component's alloted space begins
        yy - the y-position on the graphics image that this component's alloted space begins
        ww - the width on the graphics image that this component is given
        hh - the height on the graphics image this component is given

      • renderInverse

        public void renderInverse​(boolean inverse)
        Parameters:
        inverse - sets inverseRender

      • setScrollButtons

        public void setScrollButtons​(RadioButton scrollNeg,
                             RadioButton scrollPos)
        Sets the buttons to be linked to this scroll bar. The scroll bar will set these to editable or uneditable when necessary, but will not provide any other function.
        Parameters:
        scrollNeg - a button that when pressed, should make this bar scroll in the negative direction
        scrollPos - a button that when pressed, should make this bar scroll in the positive direction

      • setOffsets

        public void setOffsets​(int totalOffs,
                       int barOffs,
                       int offset)
        Sets all of the offsets at once. Used for an initialization or change of state. Sets them in the order that they are listed for the sake of logical cohesion, otherwise offset may temporarily be an at illegal value if updated before total and bar offsets.
        Parameters:
        totalOffs - to replace totalOffs
        barOffs - to replace barOffs
        offset - to replace offset
        See Also:
        setTotalOffs(int, boolean), setBarOffs(int), setOffset(int)

      • getOffset

        public int getOffset()
        Returns the offset of the scroll bar. The offset is the value that determines how far the bar is on the line. The minimum offset value is 0 and the maximum is totalOffs-barOffs.
        Returns:
        offset

      • setOffset

        public void setOffset​(int offset)
        Sets the offset of the scroll bar. If the offset provided is out of range, the closest value to provided will be used. Additionally, this will update the editability of scrollNeg and scrollPos if they are not null.
        Parameters:
        offset - the new value for offset

      • getTotalOffs

        public int getTotalOffs()
        Returns the total number of offset ticks that the bar has.
        Returns:
        totalOffs

      • setTotalOffs

        public void setTotalOffs​(int total)
        Sets the total number of offsets for the scroll bar. This method is useful for more internal workings of the scroll bar. It will set the new totalOffs, decrease offset if it is too high, then updateScrollButtons().
        Parameters:
        total - the new variable to be totalOffs. Must be greater than 0.

      • setTotalOffs

        public void setTotalOffs​(int total,
                         boolean pullPositive)
        Sets the total number of offsets for the scroll bar like setTotalOffs(int).

        The offset may change based on the new value for totalOffs to have it keep its place. If offset is at 0 when this method is called, it stay at zero. However, if it is any higher and pullPositive is true, offset will be shifted by the amount that totalOffs changes.

        Regardless, the editability of scrollNeg and scrollPos may change due to this method.

        Parameters:
        total - the new variable to be totalOffs. Must be greater than 0.
        pullPositive - whether it is logical to shift based on a total offsets change. If data is being added at the minimum value of offset side for this bar, then the bar should resultantly pull positively to compensate. For example, if this scroll bar is keeping track of the user's index in a list, and a new entry is added to the front of that list, then what was once at index 0 shifts to index 1, what was once at index 1 goes to index 2, etc. The offset will thus increase to match that change.
        However, if data is being added to the maximum value side, then no offset change needs to occur.

      • setBarOffs

        public void setBarOffs​(int offs)
        Sets the number of offset ticks the bar occupies.
        Parameters:
        offs - sets barOffs

      • getBarOffs

        public int getBarOffs()
        Returns the number of offsets the button on the bar takes up.
        Returns:
        barOffs

      • updateScrollButtons

        protected void updateScrollButtons()

      • drag

        public double[] drag​(double deltaX,
                     double deltaY)
        Description copied from interface: DraggableComponent
        This method is called by the menu manager to signal that the mouse has moved x and y pixels since the component was clicked or last updated.
        Specified by:
        drag in interface DraggableComponent
        Parameters:
        deltaX - the change in x of the mouse
        deltaY - the change in y of the mouse
        Returns:
        an two-element array of how much change was used by the drag in x and y respectively. Any left over movement will be saved in the MenuManager and summed with new change when it occurs. This makes it possible that if the mouse hasn't changed enough to cause a change in the state of the draggable the first time, it will add up over several occurrences.

      • setTouched

        public void setTouched​(boolean touched)
        Sets whether this button on the scroll bar is touched. If the touched color isn't set, then an outline toggle will be used to show touch. Therefore, setting the touch here may trigger the toggle.
        Specified by:
        setTouched in interface TouchResponsiveComponent
        Overrides:
        setTouched in class Clickable
        Parameters:
        touched - whether the component is touched by the mouse: Clickable.touched.

      • setTouchedColor

        public void setTouchedColor​(java.awt.Color touchedColor)
        If the touched color is null, then the toggle outline effect will be used instead
        Parameters:
        touchedColor - to replace colorTouched

      • getFillColor

        public java.awt.Color getFillColor()
        Called in rendering. Gives the fill color of the scroll bar's button. If the scroll bar is not editable, color is used. If the button is clicked, colorDark is used. If the button is touched and has colorTouched set, that is used. Otherwise, the normal colorButton is returned.
        Returns:
        the applicable color for rendering the fill of the scroll bar's button

      • setScrollRate

        public void setScrollRate​(int offsetRate)
        Sets the number of offsets that this scroll bar should be shifted for each unit of mouse scrolling applied.
        Parameters:
        offsetRate - sets the value of scrollRate

      • getScrollRate

        public int getScrollRate()
        Returns the number of offsets that this scroll bar should be shifted for each unit of mouse scrolling. Called by MenuManager.mouseScrolled(int, int, int) to determine how much the offset of this bar should be altered.
        Returns:
        the value of scrollRate
